topic.title: question about file hosting
topic.body: i was wondering what the best way to host files on zeronet would be.  I dont want to include files with my zite because then viewers would be downloading them whether they wanted to or not and additionally it would significantly increase the size of the zite.  I also want to use a decentralized method so that files cant easily be censored.  Does zeronet offer any good options to do this? I know there are zites like zeroup that will do this but im not sure if that is better than using bittorrent and a magnet link.  Also if anyone knows of an anonomous method of hosting the files that would be awesome but not necessary . Thanks :)

topic.title: Can time keeping be achieved in zeronet?
topic.body: I was thinking about how a messaging platform where messages expire and are removed after a set amount of time would work on zeronet.  i can't figure out how to keep track of time though.  my best idea is to have each post timestamped based on the poster's computer time and from there a central server would continuously check each post and remove ones that have been online past the set expiration date and then push out a new version of the zite.  although this relies on a central server, if the central server were to go offline, the only affect on the zite would be that the old messages are no longer removed.  I dont know if zeronet can use a computer's time to timestamp a post or if a central server could remove expired posts though.  i thought about having a buffer where only a set amount of posts are allowed to be "online" but someone could just spam posts and push out real posts.  does anyone else have any ideas?

topic.title: content signing failed, content too large?
topic.body: does anyone know how to resolve this error?

topic.title: 80% Glock build
topic.body:
Reposting because someone threatened to block my zite if i didnt add a description. just kidding, i aint nobody's bitch, i just thought i should add some more details about my zite so that people arent blindly clicking on a link.  This is an 80% glock 26 compatible kit that i built.  Its not a tutorial, just an overview of the project.  The special thing about 80% firearms is that they arent considered firearms until you put the finishing touches on them.  That means that the government (excluding some states) doesnt and cant track them.  Since they are not firearms they are not required to have a serial number when they are sold and you are not obligated to serialize or report them to the government when you build them.  They require no special license to build, the only caveat being that you do not build them with the intent to sell them.  Additionally, since they are not firearms, just chunks of plastic or metal, you can get them shipped straight to your door.  The only part of a firearm that is considered a firearm is the lower receiver which is what is the "80%" part that you must complete the last "20%" of to make it into a firearm.  The rest of the parts are unregulated and can be freely bought and sold.  These are commonly referred to as "ghost guns" because they cannot be tracked by the government.  This is a good thing though as it prevents the government from knowing who they can take firearms away from if they wanted to.  Canada recently banned many types of firearms that were on a registry which means that the government knows exactly who has them and therefore they can effectively enforce the ban.  This is related to zeronet if you look at the problem from a censorship perspective.  If the government tries to censor firearms, they cannot effectively do that if they dont know where to look for them.  Zeronet exists to avoid censorship by preventing anyone from being able to shut down the spread of information easily.  I only speak about 80% firearms according to United States law, other countries may have other laws concerning them.
here is my zite: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LPTwy3E2sQThsiuDJpo6PdmQbLbUsq5kA/

1578573647_1G9k2b4cSRzZSfLQuzxmpJB3LT3Gf.body: i think the best option is to ban them individually.  a ban by "admin" is called censorship, something that this platform was created to evade....

1585269932_1Drej4kKBea1TryGPYfVZgzDxaB71.body: i think that we no longer need such large machines.  we could build such large things again if we needed to but there is no need.  we have better technologies that allow us to do much more in a more efficient manner.  a popular example is that the iphone 4 is more powerful than the computers that took humans to the moon.  the computers of old were huge and filled entire buildings while only being able to do simple math but now they are much more capable in such a smaller form factor.  if you want an example of huge modern machinery, look at todays largest ships.  here is a link with many depictions of the titanic vs todays ships https://duckduckgo.com/?q=titanic+size+comparison&t=brave&iax=images&ia=images
